awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Geometry and Topology of Submanifolds
awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator will study the geometry and                     topology of tight and taut submanifolds.  In particular, he will                investigate tight submanifolds that are either analytic or orbits               of an orthogonal action.  Furthermore, the difference between the               topology and geometry of two special cases, Dupin and                           isoparametric hypersurfaces, will be the subject of particular                  attention.                                                                           Tight and taut submanifolds are the topological analogues of               geometer's minimal surfaces.  These in turn are mathematical                    models for everyday soap films. A soap film, while in the process               of being blown is neither tight nor taut.  Prior to being blown,                the film had both these properties. The principal investigator                  will solve several mathematics problems which arise from the                    study of such films.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
